definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: Tonight we saw a real tear-jerker.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我们看了一部十分令人感伤的电影。

sentences.english: The play last night was a tear-jerker.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚的戏剧是很令人感伤的戏剧。

sentences.english: She always enjoys going to see a tear-jerker .
sentences.chinese: 她老是喜欢去看令人感伤的电影。

sentences.english: I would have cried and laughed less while watching television - and more while watching life.
sentences.chinese: 我会更多的关注生活，而不去对着电视感伤。

sentences.english: With touching pathos he described the pangs of hunger.
sentences.chinese: 他以极具感伤力的笔触描述了饥饿的痛苦。

sentences.english: In the similar night, whether you are the same, also sad in the static regret.
sentences.chinese: 在这相似的深夜里，你是否一样，也在静静追悔感伤。

sentences.english: Growth has permitted the social stratification which even the Daily Mail now laments.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长使社会分层，甚至《每日邮报》都为此感伤。

sentences.english: We parted at curbside , without too much soppy stuff and no tears.
sentences.chinese: 我们在路边分手，没有太多感伤的情节也没有流泪。

sentences.english: Why should the sad self sentimentas, people in the heart of friendship in.
sentences.chinese: 何须自我悲感伤，人在心在情亦在。

sentences.english: February:Return to the hometown, throwing all your past cares aside.
sentences.chinese: 回一次家乡，抛开过去的所有感伤。

sentences.english: Ignore it, would at flower hurt English remnants behind sigh in sorrow grief.
sentences.chinese: 漠视它，只会在花败英残后哀叹感伤。

sentences.english: That movie certainly was a tear-jerker.
sentences.chinese: 那无疑是一部很令人感伤的电影。

sentences.english: Touch my heart lost for a long time desolate, humming.
sentences.chinese: 抚摸心头的荒芜，哼唱内心遗落许久的感伤。

sentences.english: Something both sentimental and profound welled up.
sentences.chinese: 它既感伤又深刻地在此刻涌现出来。

sentences.english: If tree is conscious，he will be sentimental.
That is a novel reeking with sentimentalism .
sentences.chinese: 那是一本充满著感伤主义的小说。

definition: to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
